meanings.definition: Replace (a contract or obligation) with a new one.
meanings.sent1: I will novate the old agreement with a fresh one.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to novate the outdated contract.
meanings.sent3: After much negotiation, they agreed to novate the deal over dinner.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to novate the terms of their friendship to be more equal.
meanings.sent5: The decision to novate the terms was a breath of fresh air for both parties.

meanings.definition: Transfer (a right or liability) to another party.
meanings.sent1: He will novate the responsibility to his colleague.
meanings.sent2: The landlord decided to novate the lease to a new tenant.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to novate his tricks to the audience.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to novate her worries to someone else.
meanings.sent5: The decision to novate the ownership brought relief to the original holder.
